Description:
AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IMPLEMENT COMPETENCY-BASED ADVANCED MANUFACTURING PROGRAMS IN THE CONTINUING EDUCATION SPACE AT AMARILLO COLLEGE THAT ALIGN TO NEW PROGRAMS BEING DEVELOPED IN THE ACADEMIC AREAS. PROJECT WIN PROPOSES TO COMPLEMENT AND SUPPORT THE REGIONAL SHIFT TOWARD INDUSTRY 4.0 BY DEVELOPING ACCELERATED CONTINUING EDUCATION PATHWAYS, UTILIZING EQUITY-MINDED COMPETENCY-BASED CURRICULA, THAT WILL TARGET DISADVANTAGED AND UNDERREPRESENTED GROUPS IN THE PANHANDLE THAT HISTORICALLY ARE LESS LIKELY TO FIND OPPORTUNITIES IN INDUSTRY-LEADING CAREERS WITH HIGH-WAGE SALARIES AND ECONOMIC LONGEVITY


ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
AT THE CONCLUSION OF THE GRANT, AMARILLO COLLEGE WILL HAVE DEVELOPED THE FIRST AREA PROGRAM WHICH OFFERS ADVANCED MANUFACTURING ACCELERATORS UP TO 12-WEEKS IN LENGTH CONSISTING OF 4 ACCELERATED NON-CREDIT TO CREDIT PATHWAY PROGRAMS WHERE A PARTICIPANT CAN EARN UP TO 24 MICRO-CREDENTIALS THROUGH SMARTAUTOMATION CERTIFICATE ALLIANCE (SACA).


DELIVERABLES
CAPACITY BUILDING 1: AMARILLO COLLEGE WILL BUILD 1 NEW ADVANCED MANUFACTURING NONCREDIT TO
CREDIT ACCELERATED COMPETENCY-BASED ELEARNING PROGRAM.
CAPACITY BUILDING 2: INTRODUCE 24 SACA MICRO-CREDENTIALS TO BUILD SKILLS IN AUTOMATION AND
ADVANCED INDUSTRIAL MAINTENANCE AND OPERATION IN INDUSTRY 4.0/ADVANCED MANUFACTURING FACILITIES
IN THE REGION.
CAPACITY BUILDING 3: BUILD AN ADVANCED MANUFACTURING ASSOCIATION AS PART OF THE CURRENT BUSINESS
AND LEADERSHIP COUNCIL TO SUPPORT INDUSTRY-STUDENT MENTORING, STUDENT TRANSITION TO WORK-BASED
LEARNING INCLUDING INTERNSHIPS AND APPRENTICESHIPS, AND TO ALIGN TRAINING NEEDS FOR INCUMBENT
WORKERS.
EQUITY 1: RECRUIT AND TRAIN STUDENTS OF COLOR,WITH A FOCUS ON BLACK AND LATINX MEN AND WOMEN,
OPPORTUNITY YOUTH, AND INCUMBENT OR DISPLACED WORKERS FOR CAREERS IN ADVANCED MANUFACTURING.
EQUITY 2: STRENGTHEN SUPPORTS FOR INDIVIDUALS OF COLOR, WITH A FOCUS ON BLACK/LATINX MALES,
OPPORTUNITY YOUTH, WOMEN, AND INCUMBENT OR DISPLACED WORKERS TO ENSURE PROGRAM OF STUDY
COMPLETION.


INTENDED BENEFICIARY
NONTRADITIONAL POPULATIONS IN MANUFACTURING INCLUDING
DISCONNECTED/OPPORTUNITY YOUTH, ADULT LEARNERS OF COLOR FOCUSING ON HISPANIC/LATINX AND
BLACK/AFRICAN AMERICANS, UNEMPLOYED OR UNDEREMPLOYED, INCUMBENT WORKERS.


SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
N/A

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ENHANCE EQUITY AND PROGRAM COMPLETION AMONG FIRST-GENERATION STUDENTS AND
STUDENTS OF COLOR IN INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY PROGRAMS, WHILE INCREASING INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY FOR COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AS A MEANS TO DRIVE IMPROVED EQUITY AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY.


ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
NORTHEAST STATE PROPOSES TO IMPLEMENT THE STRENGTHENING EQUITY AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT IN NORTHEAST TENNESSEE PROJECT TO ENHANCE EQUITY AND PROGRAM COMPLETION AMONG FIRST-GENERATION STUDENTS AND STUDENTS OF COLOR IN INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY PROGRAMS OF STUDY WHILE INCREASING INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY FOR COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AS A MEANS TO DRIVE IMPROVED EQUITY AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY IN THE REGION. CORE STRATEGIES OF THE PROJECT INCLUDE: 
(1) IMPLEMENTING AN INTEGRATED COACHING AND PEER MENTORING MODEL;
 (2) MODIFYING CURRICULUM AND DEVELOPING A CYBER RANGE TO INTEGRATE APPLIED LEARNING IN COMPUTER INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY PROGRAMS; AND 
(3) DEVELOPING ENHANCED, COMMUNITY-BASED OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT OF MARGINALIZED AND UNDERREPRESENTED POPULATIONS. 


DELIVERABLES
CAPACITY BUILDING OUTCOME #1: IMPLEMENT AN ENHANCED COACHING MODEL THAT INCORPORATES
PEER MENTORING FOR CIT STUDENTS IN THE SECOND YEAR OF THEIR PROGRAM OF STUDY
CAPACITY BUILDING OUTCOME #2: IMPROVE COMPUTER INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY (CIT) PROGRAMS
OF STUDY BY DEVELOPING A CYBER RANGE TO ENHANCE APPLIED LEARNING AND TRANSITIONS TO
WORKPLACE ENVIRONMENTS
CAPACITY BUILDING OUTCOME #3: DEVELOP NEW CAPACITY TO ADDRESS EQUITY THROUGH ENHANCED,
COMMUNITY-BASED OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT OF MARGINALIZED AND UNDERREPRESENTED
POPULATIONS, SPECIFICALLY LOW-INCOME AND FIRST-GENERATION STUDENTS, STUDENTS OF COLOR, AND THEIR
FAMILIES.

EQUITY OUTCOME #1: INCREASE ENROLLMENT OF STUDENTS OF COLOR IN CIT PATHWAYS
EQUITY OUTCOME #2: INCREASE PROGRAM COMPLETION RATES AMONG FIRST-GENERATION COLLEGE
STUDENTS AND STUDENTS OF COLOR IN CIT PATHWAYS.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
FIRST-GENERATION COLLEGE STUDENTS AND STUDENTS OF COLOR IN COMPUTER INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY PROGRAM OF STUDY, WHICH MAY INCLUDE DISLOCATED WORKERS, INCUMBENT
WORKERS, AND/OR NEW ENTRANTS TO THE WORKFORCE


SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
EXTERNAL EVALUATION SERVICES

AWARD PURPOSE
REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIPS - DONE RIGHT (RADAR) BUILDS THE CAPACITY FOR BISMARCK STATE COLLEGE TO ENHANCE CAREER PATHWAYS LEADING TO REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS THAT WILL INCREASE EQUITY AND REMOVE BARRIERS FOR STUDENTS TO ENTER THE WORKFORCE FOR A HIGHER WAGE IN-DEMAND EMPLOYMENT.


ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
BSC'S PROJECT, REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIPS – DONE RIGHT (RADAR), WILL RECRUIT AND SUPPORT DIVERSE, UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS; OFFER EXPANDED EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING; PREPARE STUDENTS FOR THE WORKFORCE, AND IMPROVE THE ECONOMY IN RURAL NORTH DAKOTA. THE SUCCESSFUL IMPLEMENTATION OF THE RADAR PROJECT WILL PROVIDE A GREATER NUMBER OF HIGHLY QUALIFIED WORKERS IN HIGH-DEMAND JOB OPPORTUNITIES IN THE HEALTHCARE AND MANUFACTURING INDUSTRIES. AS A RAP INTERMEDIARY BSC WILL BE ABLE TO 1. PROVIDE INDUSTRY AND/OR WORKFORCE SPECIFIC EXPERTISE (E.G., CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT, HANDS-ON COMPETENCIES, ETC.) TO SUPPORT EMPLOYERS 2. SERVE AS SPONSOR OF AN APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAM, TAKING RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE PROGRAM 3. ESTABLISHED PARTNERSHIPS WITH SMALL AND MEDIUM SIZED EMPLOYERS, ESPECIALLY IN RURAL AREAS, THAT MAY NOT HAVE THE CAPACITY TO DEVELOP AN APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAM ON THEIR OWN 4. PROVIDER OF RELATED TRAINING INSTRUCTION AND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES AS APPROPRIATE 5. ENGAGEMENT WITH THE LEADERSHIP BILT AND SECTOR BILTS TO SUPPORT APPRENTICESHIP EXPANSION 6. USE PLA TO GIVE CREDIT TOWARDS DEGREE PROGRAM FOR NON-CREDIT, INDUSTRY RECOGNIZED CREDENTIALS 7. ESTABLISH AND IMPLEMENT AN OUTREACH PLAN FOR THE TARGETED INDUSTRIES. ADDITIONALLY, THE RADAR PROJECT WILL 1. ENGAGE WITH JSND, DOCR, AND BILT TO SUPPORT APPRENTICESHIP PATHWAY FOR INCARCERATED INDIVIDUALS 2. USE PLA TO GIVE CREDIT TOWARDS DEGREE PROGRAM FOR NON-CREDIT, INDUSTRY-RECOGNIZED CREDENTIALS, 3. ADMISSIONS COUNSELORS, STAFF, AND FACULTY ADVISORS ARE TRAINED TO UNDERSTAND THE RA PATHWAY MODEL FOR EX-OFFENDERS.


DELIVERABLES
CAPACITY BUILDING OUTCOME 1: STREAMLINE THE REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP CREATION, MAINTENANCE, AND FUNDING PROCESS FOR EMPLOYERS AS AN INTERMEDIARY APPRENTICESHIP PROVIDER.
CAPACITY BUILDING OUTCOME 2: ESTABLISH A HEALTH SCIENCES CAREER PATHWAYS TO PREPARE WORKFORCE-READY GRADUATES IN INDUSTRY-RECOGNIZED CREDENTIALS, CERTIFICATE AND TWO- AND FOUR-YEAR DEGREES TO ADDRESS WORKFORCE SHORTAGE IN THE REGION.
CAPACITY BUILDING OUTCOME 3: ESTABLISH AN AUTOMATION/ROBOTICS CAREER PATHWAYS TO PREPARE WORKFORCE-READY GRADUATES IN INDUSTRY RECOGNIZED CREDENTIALS, CERTIFICATE AND TWO- AND FOUR-YEAR DEGREES TO ADDRESS WORKFORCE SHORTAGE IN THE REGION.
EQUITY OUTCOME 1: DEVELOP PROCEDURES AND PROCESSES TO PROVIDE RELATED TECHNICAL INSTRUCTION (RTI) AND SERVE AS AN INTERMEDIARY FOR INCARCERATED INDIVIDUALS ENROLLED IN THE REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP (RA) PROGRAM AT THE ND DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS ROUGH RIDER INDUSTRIES.
EQUITY OUTCOME 2: COORDINATE AND ESTABLISH CONNECTIONS FOR TARGETED POPULATIONS WITH BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT TO RECEIVE WRAP-AROUND SERVICES.


INTENDED BENEFICIARY
NEW AMERICANS, MINORITIES, VETERANS, INCARCERATED INDIVIDUALS, EX-OFFENDERS, CAREER CHANGERS, RURAL AND OTHER UNDERREPRESENTED GROUPS.


SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
N/A

APPLICANT NAME: VIRGINIA COMMUNITY COLLEGE SYSTEM (VCCS)PROJECT TITLE: VIRGINIA WORKFORCE DATA QUALITY INITIATIVE (WDQI) PROJECTPROJECT PURPOSE: THE VIRGINIA COMMUNITY COLLEGE SYSTEMS (VCCS) WORKFORCE DATA QUALITY INITIATIVE (WDQI) PROJECT SUPPORTS CONTINUED DEVELOPMENT AND USE OF A WORKFORCE LONGITUDINAL DATA SYSTEM, KNOWN AS THE WORKFORCE DATA TRUST (WDT). VIRGINIA IS REQUESTING AN LP2 PROJECT TO BUILD UPON PREVIOUS AND CURRENT PROGRESS IN BUILDING THE WDT. THIS WDQI PROJECT FUNDING REQUEST WILL CONTINUE TO IMPROVE WORKFORCE PROGRAM DATA COLLECTION, ANALYSIS, AND USE. A KEY STRATEGY FOR THE COMMONWEALTH IS DEVELOPING THE WDT TO FACILITATE AND PROMOTE USE OF LINKED LONGITUDINAL DATA BETWEEN THE VIRGINIA LONGITUDINAL DATA SYSTEM (VLDS) AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS. VIRGINIAS PROPOSED WDQI PROJECT: (1) BUILDS AND EXPANDS THE WDT (WORKFORCE LONGITUDINAL DATABASE)  (2) IMPROVES THE QUALITY OF WORKFORCE DATA  (3) IMPROVES THE CAPACITY OF THE VLDS AND WDT TO INTERFACE  (4) ENABLES COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND TRAINING PROGRAMS  (5) PRODUCES AND DISSEMINATES TRAINING PROVIDER INFORMATION AND OUTCOMES  (6) IMPROVES THE GOVERNANCE STRUCTURE AND SHARED ACCOUNTABILITY FROM RELEVANT STATE AGENCIES AND PROGRAMS  AND (7) ENHANCES DATA COLLECTION, STORAGE, AND PRIVACY.FUNDING LEVEL REQUESTED:  2,900,000ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: (1) TECHNOLOGY AND INFRASTRUCTURE ROAD MAP: VLDS AND WDT  (2) IMPLEMENT TECHNOLOGY AND INFRASTRUCTURE CHANGES IDENTIFIED IN THE TECHNOLOGY ROAD MAP  (3) DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT A COLLABORATIVE DATA GOVERNANCE STRUCTURE BETWEEN ENTITIES  (4) DEVELOP NEW REPORTING METRICS, PROCESSES AND ANALYTICAL FRAMEWORK  (5) CONDUCT A LANDSCAPE STUDY OF WORKFORCE PROGRAMS AND DATA COLLECTION PROCESSES WITH A FOCUS TO IMPROVE DEI OUTCOMES  (6) IDENTIFY AND CHANGE AND POLICY AND PRACTICE CHANGES FOR DATA COLLECTION  (7) ENHANCE UI WAGE DATA COLLECTION  (8) LINK INDIVIDUAL-LEVEL WORKFORCE PROGRAM DATA TO UI AND EDUCATION DATA  (9) DEVELOP TECHNOLOGICAL CONNECTIONS BETWEEN VOEE, VLDS AND WDT  (10) CREATE A WORKGROUP ON DATA MATCHING WITH REPRESENTATIVES FOR RELEVANT AGENCY STAKEHOLDERS  (11) DEVELOP A COMMON METHOD FOR DATA MATCHING SO THAT IT IS LIKE ACROSS THE TWO SYSTEMS  (12) IN-DEMAND AND FUNDING STREAM DASHBOARD DESIGN, TESTED AND PUBLISHED  (13) DESIGN AND PUBLISH CLIENT-FACING PROGRAMOF-STUDY SCORECARD  AND (14) COMPREHENSIVE ADMINISTRATIVE-FACING CASE MANAGEMENT.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: (1) ALL VIRGINIA WORKFORCE AND EDUCATION AGENCIES ARE CONTRIBUTING DATA THROUGH A COMMON TECHNOLOGY-BASED DATA ARCHITECTURE AND LONGITUDINAL INFRASTRUCTURE ASSESSED THROUGH AN ANNUAL AUDIT AND REVIEW PROCESS  (2) KPIS ARE ESTABLISHED WITH PERFORMANCE REVIEWS ON A BIANNUAL BASIS ENSURING LINKED DATA IS FUNCTIONAL WITH 90  UPTIME AND AVAILABILITY  (3) 90  OF AVAILABLE WORKFORCE EDUCATION AND TRAINING PROGRAM DATA ARE ADDED TO THE VLDS WDT DATA DICTIONARY. AT LEAST TWO NEW WORKFORCE PROGRAMS ARE ENGAGED VIA SIGNED MOUS AND SHARING DATA  (4) THE NUMBER OF WORKFORCE DATA POINTS AVAILABLE FOR THE MATCH ON UNIQUE CLIENT IDENTIFIERS INCREASED BY 50  OVER THE BASELINE. ANNUAL AUDIT OF MATCHED EDUCATION AND WORKFORCE DATA INDICATES ABOVE 90  OF PERFORMANCE-RELEVANT FIELDS ARE ACCESSIBLE TO USERS  (5) KPIS ARE DEVELOPED BASED ON THE LATTICE OF COMMONALITIES LINKING WORKFORCE DATASETS REPORTING TO WORKFORCE PROGRAM ADMINISTRATORS. ACCURACY OF LINKED DATA ASSESSED THROUGH ANNUAL AUDIT PROCESS AT EXCEEDING 95   (6) 50  REDUCTION IN THE MEAN DAYS PER MONTH NECESSARY TO PROCESS RESEARCH REQUESTS THROUGH THE VLDS RESEARCH PORTAL  (7) NEW ETPL PROGRAM TO OCCUPATION CROSSWALK COMPLETED BY VOEE. NEW ETPL REPORTING SYSTEM LIVE INTEGRATING PROGRAM COMPLETION DATA AND QUARTERLY ALIGNED OCCUPATION DEMAND AND  (8) DASHBOARD USER METRICS ESTABLISHED WITH MONTHLY REPORTING OF HOW EACH DASHBOARD IS BEING ACCESSED BY WORKFORCE SYSTEM ADMINISTRATION AND CLIENTS.

APPLICANT NAME: PENNSYLVANIA DEPARTMENT OF LABOR   INDUSTRYPROJECT TITLE: WORKFORCE DATA QUALITY INITIATIVE (WDQI) ROUND 9 PURPOSE: TO DEVELOP A COMPREHENSIVE WORKFORCE LONGITUDINAL ADMINISTRATIVE DATABASE (WLAD) IN PENNSYLVANIAFUNDING REQUESTED:  2,900,000ACTIVITIES: PENNSYLVANIA IS PROPOSING TO USE WDQI GRANTS FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES THAT WILL SIGNIFICANTLY CONTRIBUTE TO THE ACHIEVEMENT OF WDQI PROGRAM OBJECTIVES AND ADVANCE THE COMMONWEALTHS GOAL OF DEVELOPING A COMPREHENSIVE WLAD: (1) PROCURE AND IMPLEMENT AN ADVANCED IDENTITY RESOLUTION AND UNIVERSAL IDENTIFIER SOFTWARE SOLUTION  (2) ONBOARD A DATA ENGINEER TO SUPPORT AND MANAGE THE UNIVERSAL IDENTIFIER SOLUTION  AND (3) PROCURE AN ADVISORY CONSULTANT TO PRODUCE A ROADMAP FOR DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING A COMPREHENSIVE WLAD IN PENNSYLVANIA.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: WITH ASSISTANCE FROM THE WDQI PROGRAM, PENNSYLVANIA PLANS TO LEVERAGE THE DATA PROCESSING ENVIRONMENT AND ANALYTICS SERVICES OF THE PENNSYLVANIA LONGITUDINAL DATA SYSTEM (PALDS) TO COMPLETE 15 RESEARCH PROJECTS WITHIN THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD. FINDINGS FROM THESE PROJECTS WILL PROVIDE INSIGHTS TO POLICYMAKERS THAT INFORM IMPROVEMENTS TO SERVICE DELIVERY AND PERFORMANCE IN EDUCATION AND WORKFORCE PROGRAMS, IN PARTICULAR FOR HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED GROUPS. THROUGH THE CREATION OF USER-FRIENDLY RESOURCES FOR THE PUBLIC, THE RESEARCH PROJECTS WE ARE PROPOSING WILL ALSO EMPOWER JOBSEEKERS TO MAKE MORE INFORMED CHOICES ABOUT THE EDUCATION AND TRAINING PROGRAMS THAT BEST MEET THEIR NEEDS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: PENNSYLVANIA IS PROPOSING THE COMMONWEALTHS OFFICE OF ADMINISTRATION (OA) AS A SUBRECIPIENT OF THIS AWARD. AS THE ENTITY HOUSING PALDS, OA WILL CONDUCT THE KEY ACTIVITIES OUTLINED IN OUR APPLICATION, INCLUDING PROCUREMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE IDENTITY RESOLUTION AND UNIVERSAL IDENTIFIER SOLUTION, ONBOARDING OF THE DATA ENGINEER, AND PROCUREMENT OF THE ADVISORY CONSULTANT THAT WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR DELIVERING THE WLAD ROADMAP.

APPLICANT: COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF LABOR AND EMPLOYMENT (CDLE)PROJECT TITLE: COLORADO WDQI PROJECT - PHASE 2PROJECT PURPOSE: EXPAND COLORADOS STATE WORKFORCE LONGITUDINAL ADMINISTRATIVE DATABASE ANDDEVELOP ROBUST TOOLS FOR ACCESSING AND VISUALIZING DATA TO IMPROVE WORKFORCE AND EDUCATIONSERVICE DELIVERY STRATEGIES AND TO INFORM EVALUATION PROJECTS.FUNDING REQUEST:  2,900,000.00PROJECT SCOPE AND ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF LABOR ANDEMPLOYMENT (CDLE) WILL EXPAND THE STATE LONGITUDINAL DATA SYSTEM (SLDS) BY ADDING AT LEAST 6NEW DATA SOURCES. BY DEVELOPING BEST-IN-CLASS DATA VISUALIZATION, PREDICTIVE MODELING, ARTIFICIALINTELLIGENCE-POWERED INTERVENTIONS, AND CAUSAL ANALYSIS TOOLS, COLORADO WILL IMPROVE JOB QUALITYAND PROGRAM OUTCOMES AND WILL ALLOW THESE OUTCOMES TO BE ANALYZED BY DEMOGRAPHICS SUCH ASRACE, GENDER, VETERAN STATUS, DISABILITY, AND OTHER IMPORTANT CHARACTERISTICS THAT ADVANCE EQUITY,DIVERSITY, INCLUSION, AND SUPPORT FOR UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. TO MAXIMIZE THE VALUE OF THESLDS, CDLE WILL ALSO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF WORKFORCE DATA, EXPAND THE CAPACITY TO MATCHWORKFORCE AND EDUCATION DATA, AND CREATE USER-FRIENDLY PORTALS TO INFORM CONSUMER CHOICE.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROJECT S PRIMARY OUTCOME IS TO CREATE A COMMON REPOSITORY FROMDISPARATE DATA STREAMS TO DEVELOP A POWERFUL SLDS THAT CAN BE QUERIED, RESEARCHED, ANDENHANCED TO GENERATE REVOLUTIONARY, CUSTOM, DATA-DRIVEN SERVICES FOR COLORADO CITIZENS. INITIALLYDEVELOPED WITH WDQI ROUND 7 FUNDING, COLORADOS SLDS SUPPORTS ANALYSIS BY RACE, ETHNICITY,GENDER, ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED, EDUCATION LEVELS, HOMELESS, NEW AMERICANS, AND DISABILITY,NEW TOOLS WILL FACILITATE DATA DISAGGREGATION ALONG THESE CHARACTERISTICS TO ELUCIDATE UNDERLYINGTRENDS AND PATTERNS TO DEVELOP DATA DRIVEN POLICIES THAT ASSIST UNDERSERVED JOB SEEKERS AND1COMMUNITIES. AND COLORADO WILL GAIN THE ABILITY TO (1) FULLY INTEGRATE WIOA DATA SOURCES  (2)CREATE A SYSTEM THAT ALLOWS  REAL TIME  DATA SHARING TO HELP REDUCE THE PROVISION OF DUPLICATESERVICES, STREAMLINE INTAKE PROCESSES, AND MAKE MIDCOURSE CORRECTIONS TO SERVICE DELIVERYMETHODS  (3) PROVIDE ACCESS TO DATA REQUIRED TO IMPROVE PREDICTIVE ANALYTICS  AND (4) ENHANCECURRENT PORTALS THAT ENABLE THE PUBLIC TO ACCESS TIMELY AND ACCURATE INFORMATION. FINALLY, THEENHANCED SLDS WILL SUPPORT THE WIOA SECTION 169 RESEARCH AND PROGRAM EVALUATIONREQUIREMENTS.

APPLICANT: STATE OF CONNECTICUT, DEPARTMENT OF LABORTITLE: WORKFORCE DATA QUALITY INITIATIVE 2023PURPOSE: THE PROJECT WILL CREATE AND DEPLOY PUBLICLY AVAILABLE TOOLS AND DASHBOARDS TO ASSIST CONNECTICUT RESIDENTS IN IDENTIFYING EDUCATION AND WORKFORCE TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES AND PATHWAYS. TO DO SO, THE PROJECT WILL ALSO INVEST IN TECHNICAL IMPROVEMENTS TO IMPROVE DATA SECURITY AND THE LINKAGE BETWEEN THE DEPARTMENT OF LABOR WORKFORCE PROGRAMS AND P20 WIN, THE CONNECTICUT STATE LONGITUDINAL DATA SYSTEM, TO ENSURE SUSTAINABILITYFUNDING LEVEL:  2,900,000PROJECT ACTIVITIES: PROJECT ACTIVITIES WILL CONSIST OF TWO RELATED ACTIVITIES: CREATION ANDDEPLOYMENT OF PUBLICLY AVAILABLE TOOLS AND DASHBOARDS TO ASSIST CONNECTICUT RESIDENTS IN IDENTIFYING EDUCATION AND WORKFORCE TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES AND PATHWAYS, AND TECHNICAL IMPROVEMENTS TO FACILITATE THE DEVELOPMENT OF THESE TOOLS THROUGH P20 WIN, THE SLDS. SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:  DEVELOPING A P20 WIN REQUEST TO CREATE A DATASET INTEGRATING EDUCATION AND WORKFORCE PATHWAYS FOR INDIVIDUALS. DEVELOPING METRICS AND VISUALIZATIONS FOR FEDERAL AND STATE-FUNDED EDUCATION AND WORKFORCE TRAINING PROGRAMS BASED ON THE P20 WIN DATASET TO USE IN A DASHBOARD AND PUBLICLY AVAILABLE TOOLS. HELPING TO INFORM INDIVIDUAL DECISION-MAKING BY PROVIDING INTERACTIVE AND USER-FRIENDLY DASHBOARDS AND TOOLS THAT INCLUDE PROGRAM OUTCOMES, SUCH AS EMPLOYMENT RATES AND WAGES.  UNDERSTANDING THE PERFORMANCE OF PROGRAMS IN SERVING HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED GROUPS BY DISAGGREGATING PERFORMANCE METRICS BY RACE, ETHNICITY, GENDER, DISABILITY, VETERAN STATUS, AND ADDITIONALLY IDENTIFIED UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES IN CONNECTICUT. UPDATING THE REQUEST AND TOOLS ANNUALLY DURING THE TERM OF THE GRANT. DEVELOPING QUERIES AND TOOLS TO AUTOMATE CREATION OF FUTURE DATA REQUESTS TO EXTENT POSSIBLE.IMPROVEMENTS TO DATA SECURITY AND LINKAGE BETWEEN THE DEPARTMENT OF LABOR WORKFORCE PROGRAMS AND P20 WIN WILL GO HAND-IN-HAND WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF TOOLS TO ENSURE SUSTAINABILITY. PROJECT ACTIVITIES RELATED TO DATA SECURITY AND DATA LINKAGE WILL INCLUDE:  DATA MATCHING PROCESS AND SYSTEM UPGRADES: IDENTIFYING TOOLS FOR MATCHING WORKFORCE, EDUCATION PROGRAMS AND WAGE DATA TO REPLACE EXISTING APPLICATIONS, CONSIDER BUILD VS. BUY OPTIONS AND EITHER PROCURE OR DEVELOP SOLUTIONS.  IMPROVING DATA TRANSFER AND SHARING PROCESS AND SYSTEM UPGRADES: IDENTIFYINGIMPROVEMENTS TO DATA TRANSFER TOOLS TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL SECURITY, INCLUDING AUTOMATED 2TRANSFER (SUCH AS API-LED INTEGRATION, RATHER THAN MANUAL TRANSFER), DEDICATED UPLOAD   DOWNLOAD LINKS, NOTIFICATION OPTIONS UPON UPLOAD   DOWNLOAD   DELETION OF FILES, TOOLS TO FACILITATE DATA MATCHING AND TO REDUCE RELIANCE ON TRANSFER OF PII IN FEDERATED SYSTEM.  PILOTING A SECURE DATA ENCLAVE TO USE FOR SHARED ANALYSIS AND DEVELOPMENT OF WORKFORCE METRICS AND VISUALIZATIONS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THE PROJECT ACTIVITIES WILL BE:  ENHANCED USE OF WORKFORCE DATA TO INFORM DECISION-MAKING: BY PROVIDING INTERACTIVE AND USER-FRIENDLY DASHBOARDS AND TOOLS, POLICYMAKERS AND PRACTITIONERS, INCLUDING MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNORS WORKFORCE COUNCIL, WILL HAVE ACCESS TO ACCURATE, TIMELY DATA ON WORKFORCE PROGRAMS.  INCREASED CROSS-AGENCY COORDINATION AND EFFICIENCIES TO SUSTAIN ANALYTICAL CAPACITY AND TO MANAGE STAFF TURNOVER THROUGH THE SLDS.  INCREASED USE OF HIGH-QUALITY DATA IN DECISION-MAKING FOR POLICY AND PRACTICE. THIS IS THE VISION FOR P20 WIN AND MEASUREMENT OF THIS OUTCOME WILL PRIMARILY BE QUALITATIVE AND MAY INVOLVE TRACKING USE OF DASHBOARDS AND REPORTS BY AGENCY LEADERSHIP OR IDENTIFYING SPECIFIC PROGRAMMATIC OR IMPLEMENTATION CHANGES MADE BASED ON THE CAREER PATHWAYS DASHBOARDS AND REPORTS.
PRIORITIZING EQUITY IN EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES PATHWAYS AT HARPER  EMERGINGTECH HARPER
INCREASING CAPACITY AND EQUITY THROUGH A WORKFORCE INSTRUCTION REENTRY DEPARTMENT  WIRED
CLOSING EQUITY GAPS THROUGH ACCELERATED PATHWAYS  CEGAP

INCREASING ACCESS, THE NEXT GENERATION OF HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONALS

CLOSING EQUITY GAPS IN ALLIED HEALTH
PATHWAYS TO ACCESSING TRAINING IN HEALTHCARE-MINNESOTA  PATH-MN
THE MANUFACTURING EDGE  TULSA COMMUNITY COLLEGE TRAINING GRANTS PARTNERSHIP
SOUTH CAROLINA RURAL TECHNICAL COLLEGES CONSORTIUM  SCRTCC
PROGRAM FOR OPPORTUNITY AND WORKFORCE EQUITY IN THE REGION  POWER
INDUSTRIAL MAINTENANCE AND COMMUNITY COLLEGES  A PATHWAY FORWARD

Award Type: DIRECT PAYMENT FOR SPECIFIED USE, AS A SUBSIDY OR OTHER NON-REIMBURSABLE DIRECT FINANCIAL AID (C)
Description:
CR#1 DISTRIBUTIONS FOR SELF GOVERNANCE COMPACTS (TPA BASE) 
AND LAW ENFORCEMENT-638 TRIBAL (PROGRAM BASE)
